oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PROTECTION OF SANDY COASTS IN DEPENDENCE OF THE DUNE - BEACH - TYPE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Erchinger, Heie Focken
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sandy coast
dune
coastal protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Barrier dunes are the natural protective structures against flooding the low-lying land during storm tides. Their strength and resistance are to be estimated in consideration of the total dune-beach-profile. For standardization of dune-beach-profiles 3 types are to be distinguished. For each of these types the necessary and the possible actions for stabilization of the barrier dunes and also of inshore dune areas are described.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 14 (1974): Proceedings of 14th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1974.; 68
